title: Sensitivity test
fullText:
In Australia, a slowly rising fault current shall be applied between the active supply conductor and earth on the load side of each single-phase RCD. Type I RCDs with a rated tripping current of 10 mA therefore shall trip between 4.5â€“10.5 mA (tester to have accuracy of 5%) during this test.
At a minimum one such test shall be applied to each single-phase RCD.
For multi-phase supplies, the test shall be carried out with a slowly rising fault current applied sequentially between each active supply conductor and earth.
The sensitivity of each RCD shall be recorded in the in-service inspection and test report.
